text:
Prince of Altea, a country on the continent of Archanea in another world. 
Descended from the same line as the hero Anri.

After he and his allies defeated the Shadow Dragon, 
he came to be known as the Hero-King.

A master of the sword from Sacae, a region of grassy plains 
on the continent of Elibe in another world.
She was raised as a nomad, ignorant to the truth of her noble lineage.
Leader of the Greil Mercenaries on the continent of Tellius in another world.

His superior sword skills and honest heart brought him 
from simple mercenary to renowned hero.

Princess of the Halidom of Ylisse in another world. 
She has the Brand of the Exalt on her left eye.

Her strong sense of justice motivated her to travel back in time 
and fight to avert a grim future.

Heir to Leonster, a kingdom in the Thracia region on the continent of Jugdral in 
another world.
He bravely fought to liberate Thracia from imperial rule.
A royal of two countries in another world─born in Hoshido, raised in Nohr.

Though blessed with the power of the First Dragons, she was burdened with a terrible 
choice when her two homelands went to war.

Son of the duke of Chalphy in a kingdom called Grannvale 
on Jugdral, a continent in another world.

Princess of Renais, a country on the continent of Magvel in another world. 
Heir to one of the Sacred Stones.
The brave prince of Renais who fought the Demon King alongside his twin sister, Eirika.

A young mercenary who became a professor at Garreg Mach Monastery in the land of 
Fódlan, a continent in another world.
He taught his students well and guided them through an age of war.

A noble knight who, as descendant of the crusader Baldr, 
inherited the legendary legacy of a sacred blade.
Princess of Zofia, a bountiful country on the continent of Valentia in another world.

Alongside the hero Alm, she fought against the Fell God who threatened her world's 
peace─but she was best known for her caring heart.
Member of a group of freedom fighters on the continent of Tellius in another world.

She used her mysterious powers to fight a goddess 
who sought to judge her entire world.

A noble of House Pherae who lived on the continent Elibe in another world. 
Wielder of the Binding Blade.
He led an army, in the stead of his ill father, against his country's enemies.
Restore HP with a vulnerary or Heal.

Vulneraries and staves have a limited number of uses. 
They will disappear when their use counter reaches 0.

If a foe wields a close-range weapon, they cannot counterattack 
if you attack them from a distance.
Attacking with knives inflicts poison.

Armorslayers and hammers are 
effective against armored units.

Poison will persist throughout a battle if not 
cured with an antitoxin or Restore staff.

When allies reach level 10 they can change to an 
advanced class using a Master Seal.
Weapons with the smash effect always attack last.
Allies can change to classes of different types using a Second Seal.

Land critical hits more often with the weapons 
killing edge, killer lance, and killer axe.

Weapons like the brave sword and brave lance make two 
consecutive attacks if you initiate combat.

When you're ready to gift the Pact Ring to an ally you care about, 
you can find it in a drawer in your room.

When an art is equipped, physical attack (Ph Atk) is affected by 
two stats: strength (Str) and magic (Mag).
Bows are effective against flying foes.

Armored units have high defense (Def), 
but are easily damaged by magic attacks.

Attack distant opponents with javelins and hand axes 
in addition to bows and magic.

The tome Surge can only attack adjacent foes, 
but it is guaranteed to hit.

Boost an ally's stats during battle with a 
strengthening item, such as an HP Tonic.

Ridersbane and weapons like poleaxes 
are effective against cavalry units.

Collect bond fragments by talking to allies 
who did well in battle.

You can use the crystals and ingredients you find 
to refine weapons and cook meals.

Rumor has it that the Somniel's guardian spirit produces bond fragments. 
How the spirit does it... Well, that's another matter entirely.

A high score in Wyvern Ride rewards 
you with bonus bond fragments.

After a round of strength training, 's 
stats will receive a slight boost in the next battle.
Animals grazing on the Somniel may leave things for you.
After cooking, a chef will sometimes pack you a meal that you can use to recover HP.

Skirmishes and training battles sometimes appear on the world map. 
Take part to earn gold and experience.

Battle allies and Emblems in the Arena 
to earn experience and deepen bonds.
Allies who fight in training battles earn even more experience after clearing them.

When you order a meal at Café Terrace, you can add 
extra ingredients to improve the experience.

In the Ring Chamber, you can use bond fragments 
to create Bond Rings.
You can harvest cooking ingredients in the orchard.

Earn bond fragments by completing the achievements 
on the bulletin board.

Use the bulletin board to donate to the regions of Elyos. Generous gifts 
increase your donation level and may yield rewards.

In skirmishes on maps with low visibility, enemies often 
yield both high experience and great riches.

The fish that you catch in the pond 
make tasty ingredients for cooking.
The flea market stocks some items that cannot be purchased elsewhere.

It is said that there are trial grounds across Elyos 
where you can deepen bonds with Emblems.
The fortune-teller is only open at night.

Fight in the Tower of Trials to earn special materials 
for upgrading engage weapons.
Press X to fast travel to your destination.

Rare foes are more likely to appear in skirmishes 
in regions with a high donation level.

Find more materials while exploring by raising your 
donation level in that region.
Use ZR to select multiple items to sell at once.

You can lower the game's difficulty by approaching your bed and selecting 
Difficulty Setting.
You can use your card to swap profiles with your friends in the Tower of Trials.

If you promote to the Divine Dragon class, you will be able to play 
Wyvern Ride at the Training Yard.

If you give an ally an especially thoughtful gift, 
you will receive additional support points.
Change the background music with the music box.

In your room you can listen to music or recall 
past conversations and memories of big events.

If you go to sleep in your room, an ally 
might come to wake you.

Use SP or bond fragments in the Ring Chamber 
to inherit Emblem skills or create Bond Rings.

Raising bond level increases available skills and 
boosts a unit's stats while synced or engaged.
The engage meter fills as you battle.

Dragon units attack additional times when using 
Emblem Marth's engage attack, Lodestar Rush.

Byleth's engage weapon changes according 
to the type of the engaged unit.

Corrin's Dragon Vein skill adds special effects to terrain, 
overwriting existing effects.

Wait in a space with Emblem energy to 
completely fill a unit's engage meter.

Ike's engage attack, Great Aether, can clear effects like flames and miasma 
where it hits.
Staff mastery skills are the only way to increase a staff's hit rate.
Review tutorials in the System menu.

Hold ZR on the battle map to change the minimap display 
or the type of unit information that is shown.

A unit's speed (Spd) will decrease if their weapon's 
weight (Wt) is higher than their build (Bld).
With high luck (Lck), you will take fewer critical hits.

Stand in thickets or woods to increase your 
chance of avoiding enemy attacks.

Select Auto-Battle to choose a strategy 
and let units fight on their own.

Weapon advantage breaks enemies: swords against axes, 
axes against lances, and lances against swords.

Broken foes cannot counterattack until after their 
next combat, so you can attack them safely.
Chain Guard cannot protect against engage attacks.
Your allies have unique skills. Press X for details.
The Unit Selection menu displays allies' classes and levels.
Turn combat animations on and off in the System menu.

Your allies earn support points when they 
fight next to each other.
Press L or R to change a selected unit's equipped weapon.
Enemies with the DropItem icon will drop an item when defeated.

If you visit a house before a foe reaches it, 
you might receive a gift.

Units on forts or protection tiles recover HP each turn 
and are not broken by weapon advantage.

The convoy is available to and adjacent units 
to store and withdraw items during battle.

Earn bond EXP to unlock conversations 
with Emblems that raise your bond level.

Earn support points to unlock conversations 
between allies that raise their support level.
Press ZL on the battle map to see the attack range of all enemies.

When allies' support levels increase, they receive a stat 
bonus when they stand adjacent to one another.

The EquipCancel symbol appears on a foe's weapon icon 
if you can break them with your attack.
Foes with BalloonCritical easily land critical hits.

Wind back actions and change past decisions 
with the Draconic Time Crystal.

If an enemy gets to a treasure chest before you do, 
you can recover the contents by defeating them.

To pass through a door, destroy it or use a 
thief's Door command.
Dragon units often receive added effects while engaged.

Move the cursor to a foe and press A 
to see their danger radius.

Backup units use chain attacks 
to support their allies.
Cavalry units have greater mobility.

Mystical units ignore terrain bonuses to a foe's 
avoid rate (Avo) when attacking with magic.
Qi adept units can cover adjacent allies with Chain Guard.

Covert units gain twice the usual bonuses to 
avoid rate (Avo) from terrain effects.
Flying units can move without being affected by terrain.
Weapon advantage cannot break armored units.

Raise your bond level with Emblems to earn the proficiencies 
needed to change classes.

Beware of dark synced foes when their engage meters 
flash─it means their engage attack is ready.

Continue training a unit that has reached max level by starting 
them at level 1 with a Second Seal.
End the player phase at any time by selecting End Turn.
Press ZR on the battle map to display additional unit information.

Attacking with an art will break foes 
using bows, tomes, and knives.

Engaged allies receive reduced damage 
from enemy engage attacks.
Press and hold Y during a conversation to fast forward.

At 100 experience points, an ally will level up 
and receive a stat increase.
Press X to see detailed information about items or skills.

Move the cursor over your units and press 
Minus 
to see more information about their abilities.

Proficiency (Prof.) is required to change a 
unit to a different class.

All units start with innate proficiencies. Units 
have the strongest potential in those areas.

Units can acquire new proficiencies from 
Emblems. This allows them to change to 
any class.
Proficiencies

To attack, move your unit close to an enemy 
and select Attack.

You can also begin an attack with A if you move 
your cursor over an enemy and see A Attack.
Attacking

Past will use the Fell Dragon 
Shard to cause avalanches that will push your 
allies away.

A warning will indicate where the avalanches 
will strike. Pay attention and move carefully!

Boulders and enemies will stop a unit's 
backward slide.
Avalanches

A barrier made by the Dark Emblems that 
reduces damage to Fell Sombron.
Defeat Dark Emblems to weaken the barrier.
Dark Barrier

As you raise the bond level between Emblems 
and units, you will unlock bond conversations.

Watch available bond conversations while 
on the Somniel or exploring the world map.

Once you view a bond conversation, you will be 
able to increase the bond level even further.
Bonds

You can use a ballista by placing a unit 
equipped with a bow on it and selecting Fire.

Ballistae have great range and power, so you can 
deal serious damage before enemies get close.

Ballistae have a limited number of 
uses, however, so plan carefully.
Ballistae

If a terrain's information says Destructible, 
then it can be attacked and destroyed.

Once the terrain is destroyed, you can pass 
through the area freely.
Destroy Terrain

Inflict the break status on an enemy by landing 
an attack with a weapon that has advantage.

Broken units cannot counterattack until after 
their next combat. This is your chance to attack!

Swords have advantage over axes, axes over 
lances, and lances over swords. Arts have 
advantage over bows, tomes, and knives.
Breaking Enemies

Once all of your units have taken action, the 
player phase ends and the enemy phase begins.

Once both phases are completed, the turn ends. 
The next turn begins with a new player phase.
Switching Phases

Units level 10 and up can use a Master Seal 
to change to an advanced class.

Changing to an advanced class makes your 
units more powerful by boosting stats and 
granting access to new weapons and skills.

You can use a Second Seal to change to a 
different type of class in the same tier.
You can change classes in the Inventory menu.
Class Change

After you move a unit, you will see a list 
of commands.

If you do not want to take an action, 
select Wait.
Commanding Units

If you see a conversation icon on a unit, move 
to an adjacent position and select Talk.

Proactively speaking with such units is a great 
way to recruit more allies.

Sometimes these units will only speak to 
specific people.
Talking

If a dancer is adjacent to a unit that has already 
acted that turn, you can select Dance.

The target of your Dance will be able to move 
and act again in the same turn.
Dancing

Dark Emblems are powerful foes, but they are 
susceptible to attacks from units synced or 
engaged with an Emblem from their world.
Dark Emblems
Some foes can also use Emblems in combat.

These Dark Emblems cannot engage, but they 
can still use engage attacks.

A light indicates when foes have engage attacks 
ready. Keep an eye out!
Dark Sync

If you head into battle while connected to the 
network, spirits representing other players' past 
battles may appear on the map.

Yellow spirits appear where many allied units 
have fallen. Earn EXP and bond EXP by waiting 
in these spaces.

Purple spirits appear where many foes have 
fallen. Wait in these spaces to pick up the 
items they left behind.
Spirits of the Fallen
You can destroy doors by attacking them.

A thief can use the Door command to unlock 
a door instead of destroying it.
Doors

Corrupted Lumera will use the power of the 
Fell Dragon Shard to unleash a potent attack.

A warning will indicate the beam's blast zone. 
Move away to avoid significant damage.
Fell Dragon Shard Beam

To destroy the Fell Dragon Shard, you must 
defeat its attendants: Zephia and Griss.

Zephia and Griss will use the shard's power 
to unleash devastating volcanic bombs.
Fell Dragon Shard

If you've reached support level A with an ally, 
you can give that ally the Pact Ring to 
strengthen your bond even further.

You can find the ring in the memento drawer 
in your room.

If you cannot find your chosen ally on 
the Somniel, try resting in bed awhile.
The Pact Ring
When the engage meter is full, select Engage.

Your unit will merge with the selected Emblem 
and gain access to special engage weapons.
Engaging also unlocks a set of special skills.
The engaged state lasts for three turns.
Engaged units can use powerful engage attacks.

Engage attacks are abilities that your units 
can use once each time they engage.

For example, Lodestar Rush deals heavy 
damage. To use this engage attack, select 
Lodestar Rush and a weapon.
Engage Attacks
Engaging

Select Manage Skills from the Inventory menu to 
see your allies' skills and equip inherited ones.

Allies can inherit skills from Emblems in 
the Ring Chamber on the Somniel.
Managing Skills

You can use a flame cannon by placing a unit 
on it and selecting Fire.

Flame cannons blast a wide area around the 
impact point and set the terrain on fire.

Be aware that the blast cannot reduce foes' HP 
below 1. It can hit your allies too, so be careful!
Flame Cannons

Select Inventory to choose the weapons 
and items that you will use in battle.

Organize your allies' equipment using 
Manage Items. Units can trade items 
with the convoy or other allies.

To automatically outfit your allies from 
the convoy, select Optimize Equipment.

Quickly return a given ally's held items to the 
convoy with Store All.
Inventory

Sometimes an Emblem's energy 
lingers in a space.

If a synced unit finishes their action or waits 
on a space containing Emblem energy, their 
engage meter will fill completely.
Emblem Energy

Select Emblem Rings 	 to partner your 
allies with Emblems. Once partnered, an 
ally can sync with an Emblem in battle.

To pair an ally and an Emblem, select an 
ally followed by an Emblem Ring .
Emblem Rings
Some powerful enemies have revival stones.

If their HP falls to 0, they will consume 
the stones to recover.

Keep attacking these enemies until they 
use up all of their revival stones.
Revival Stones

Some staves hinder enemies 
by stopping their movement or 
placing obstacles in their path.
Status Staves

Item icons on enemies indicate that you can get 
something for defeating them.

Items you can obtain will be highlighted in 
green in the enemy's inventory.
Enemy Item Drops

Allies who fight alongside Emblems gain bond 
EXP, increasing their bond level.

As their bond levels increase, units gain stats 
and access to new effects.
Bond Level

Allies without rings can move next to 
a summoned Emblem and select Talk to sync.
Syncing in Battle

You can use magic artillery by placing a unit 
equipped with a tome on it and selecting Fire.

Magic artillery is powerful and has a long range. 
It is ideal for attacking at a distance.

Like ballistae, magic artillery has a limited 
number of uses. Plan carefully.
Magic Artillery

Magic can attack both distant 
and adjacent enemies.

Magic is often effective against enemies 
with high physical defense.
Magic

Use Swap Spaces to switch allies' positions 
before starting the battle.
Select the ally you want to move with A.

Select another ally with A to swap their 
positions. Some allies cannot be moved.

Use this time to check terrain information and 
enemy stats with the cursor.
Swap Spaces

To move, select your unit with A. 
Then select where to move with StickL.

The blue spaces indicate your unit's range 
of movement.
Press A again to confirm your unit's destination.
Moving Units

Summon Emblems by placing 
near fallen rings.
Collecting Rings

Some classes, like thieves, use knives that 
inflict poison on foes they hit.
Poisoned enemies take extra damage.

Repeated knife attacks will increase the potency 
of the poison.

Units remain poisoned until the end of a battle 
or until cured with an antitoxin or Restore staff.
Status Effect: Poison

Quicksand is a terrain type that greatly reduces 
movement when a unit leaves the space.

Avoid quicksand when possible 
to maintain your mobility.
Quicksand

Each weapon has a set range. 
A bow with a range of two can 
attack enemies two spaces away.

Weapons with a range of one cannot counter 
distant attacks. Weapons with a range of two 
cannot counter adjacent attacks.
Attack Range

Foes synced with Dark Emblems may enter 
a rampage state when they use revival stones.

Be careful! Their additional strength comes from 
forcing the Emblem's powers out of control.
Rampage

A unit with 0 hit points (HP) can no longer fight. 
Use items like vulneraries to restore HP.
To use a vulnerary, select the Items command.
Healing

Enemies sometimes call in reinforcements 
during battle.

Reinforcements often arrive from forts or 
the edges of the map, so be on your guard.
Reinforcements

In dark places, only the areas around allies, 
beacons, and torches are visible.

Proceed with caution! Enemies may 
be lurking in the darkness.
Darkness

Powerful weapons like blades and greatlances 
smash on hit, driving foes back one space.

You can break foes by smashing them into units 
or other obstacles like walls.

These weapons are heavy, however. They can't 
follow up, and your foe will get to attack first 
when you initiate combat with them.
Smash Weapons

Before you begin a battle you can manage 
your items, Emblem Rings 	, and the 
team of allies who will join you.

Once your preparations are complete, select 
Fight! to begin battle.
Preparing for Battle

Some weapons have icons to indicate that they 
are effective against certain types of foes.

Such weapons inflict bonus damage to foes 
of the indicated types.
Effectiveness

As allies fight next to each other or heal each 
other, they gain support points and eventually 
unlock support conversations.

You can view support conversations on the 
Somniel or world map to increase the support 
level between characters.

Units with support levels gain stat bonuses 
when standing adjacent to one another.
Support

A unit can fight alongside an Emblem. 
This is called being synced.

While synced, the unit has increased power 
and access to sync skills.
Syncing with Emblems

Terrain provides various effects in battle. 
For example, it is harder to land a hit on a 
unit positioned in a thicket.

Thickets also cost more movement for ground 
units to pass through.

You can see terrain effects in the information 
section at the top-left corner of the screen. 
Use terrain to your advantage in battle.
Terrain Effects

You can use the Draconic Time Crystal to 
rewind and retry actions you take in battle.

Select Time Crystal from the menu. 
Use Up and 
Down to select how far back you 
would like to go, and confirm with A.
Draconic Time Crystal

To light a beacon, move next to it 
and select Light.

Uncover hidden enemies by 
illuminating darkened areas.
Beacons
Use the convoy to store and retrieve items.

Only or allies in adjacent spaces 
can use the convoy during battle.
Convoy

Stand next to treasure chests and select Chest 
to collect the items inside.

If an enemy takes the treasure first, you can 
recover it by defeating that enemy.
Treasure Chests

Certain battles must be won in a limited 
number of turns.

Meet the victory conditions before the turns 
run out, or the battle will end in defeat.
Limited Turns

Use Unit Selection to choose which allies 
will join you in combat. Press A to toggle 
IconSortie on and off.
Allies highlighted in green cannot be excluded.

Each map has a set number of allies 
who can join the fray.
Unit Selection

If you visit houses to warn them of danger, 
you may receive items or gold as a reward.

To visit, move an ally to the lit space in front of 
a house and select Visit.

Watch out! Foes may try to reach houses before 
you and destroy them.
Visiting
Volcanic bombs will strike every few turns.

The bombs destroy boulders and deal 
heavy damage to allies hit by them.

A warning will indicate where the bombs will 
fall, so take care to move out of the way.
Volcanic Bombs

Staves are items with which your units can help 
allies or hinder enemies. Only certain classes, 
like martial monks, can use them.

A Heal staff, for example, restores an ally's 
hit points (HP).

Staves are useful, but they break 
after a certain number of uses.
Staves

Review information about a unit by 
selecting them with X.

Check the Details screen for information 
about weapons and skills.
Return to battle by pressing B or X.
Details
Battle
Trials
Emblems
The Somniel
Exploration
Current Battle

The goal of a Tempest Trial is to clear several 
battle maps in succession.

For each battle you clear, you'll get materials 
and experience for the allies who took part.

Select the trial's difficulty during map selection. 
Higher difficulties yield greater rewards.
Tempest Trials

When is adjacent to an ally and 
has a full engage meter, you can select Engage+ 
to engage with them.

Emblem engages with 
the ally, and also enters 
an engaged state.

While Emblem and the engaged 
ally remain adjacent, Dragon Blast becomes the 
even more powerful Bond Blast.
Engage+

Use the world map to select a destination 
or move to the next chapter.

To continue the story, move 
to your next destination and press A.

Manage your inventory or return 
to the Somniel using the menu.
World Map

Enemy soldiers or Corrupted foes sometimes 
go back to areas that you have already cleared.

You can return to these locations for 
optional skirmishes.

Completing skirmishes can earn you experience 
and other rewards like gold and items.
Skirmishes

While connected to the network, you can see 
which units and Emblems players commonly 
deployed on a map.

This knowledge may be useful as you consider 
which units to deploy.
Rankings

As you progress through the story, special 
chapters called paralogues will appear on 
the world map.

Paralogues are optional, but they unlock unique 
benefits. You might even meet new allies!
Paralogues

Emblem Byleth's talent for instruction boosts 
allies' stats and guides them to victory.

The sync skill Divine Pulse will sometimes 
turn missed attacks into hits.

Emblem Byleth's first engage weapon is a 
Hero's Relic─an item that is different for 
each unit type.

The engage skill Instruct grants a 
stat bonus to surrounding allies.

The engage attack Goddess Dance grants a stat 
boost to adjacent allies and empowers those 
who have already acted that turn to act again.
Emblem Byleth

Emblem Celica wields powerful magic attacks. 
She is a valuable asset against Corrupted foes.

The sync skill Holy Stance reflects some 
of the damage received from Corrupted 
foes against the attacker.

The engage weapon Seraphim deals bonus 
damage to Corrupted foes.

The engage skill Echo allows a unit to initiate 
combat twice using a tome at a cost of 
50% damage.

The engage attack Warp Ragnarok teleports 
the user to a space near a distant enemy and 
attacks with powerful magic.
Emblem Celica

Emblem Eirika switches with her twin brother, 
Ephraim, to adapt to different situations.

The sync skill Lunar Brace increases damage 
dealt in proportion to the foe's defense.

The engage weapon Rapier deals bonus damage 
against cavalry and armored foes.

The engage skill Sacred Twins enables 
the unit to invoke Eirika and Ephraim's 
skills simultaneously.

The engage attack Twin Strike hits with both 
sword and lance, making it easier to break foes, 
and deals bonus damage against the Corrupted.
Emblem Eirika

Emblem Ike's robust offense and endurance 
increase as he takes damage.

The sync skill Resolve increases defense 
and resistance as HP decreases.

The engage weapon Hammer can smash foes 
and deal bonus damage to armored ones.

The engage skill Laguz Friend halves incoming 
damage but reduces avoid rate (Avo) to 0.

The engage attack Great Aether hardens the 
unit's defenses for one turn, then attacks an 
area and recovers HP.
Emblem Ike

Emblem Corrin can restrict foes' movement 
and create terrain to control the flow of battle.

The sync skill Dragon Vein adds terrain effects 
based on the user's unit type while clearing 
the same area of any flames or miasma.

The engage weapon Dual Katana, unlike most 
swords, is strong against lances and weak 
against axes.

The engage skill Dreadful Aura prevents a target 
and foes adjacent to it from moving for 1 turn 
after the user initiates combat.

The engage attack Torrential Roar blasts foes 
in front of the unit for 3 spaces, flooding the 
terrain and clearing it of flames and miasma.
Emblem Corrin

Emblem Leif's skill with a variety of weapons 
allows him to adapt to any combat situation.

The sync skill Arms Shield reduces incoming 
damage when the user has weapon advantage.

The engage weapon Killer Axe lands 
critical hits frequently.

The engage skill Adaptable automatically 
equips the most effective weapon when 
the user is attacked.

The engage attack Quadruple Hit strikes with 
a sword, lance, axe, and bow, increasing the 
chance of breaking an enemy.
Emblem Leif

Emblem Lyn excels at fighting without giving 
her opponents the chance to counterattack.

The sync skill Alacrity enables a unit much 
faster than a foe to follow up before the 
foe's counterattack.

The engage weapon Killer Bow lands 
critical hits frequently.

The engage skill Call Doubles creates illusory 
decoys of the user that can participate in 
chain attacks.

The engage attack Astra Storm unleashes five 
bow attacks on a foe from extreme range.
Emblem Lyn

Emblem Lucina's power is collaborative. 
She thrives when fighting near her allies.

The sync skill Dual Strike empowers the user 
to take part in chain attacks regardless of 
unit type.

The engage weapon Noble Rapier deals bonus 
damage to cavalry and armored foes.

The engage skill Bonded Shield creates 
a high chance of nullifying attacks against 
adjacent allies.

The engage attack All for One inspires 
all allies within 2 spaces to take part in 
a chain attack, regardless of unit type.
Emblem Lucina

Emblem can use Engage+ on 
any ally, putting both units in an engaged state 
without the need to sync.

The sync skill Bond Forger increases the 
hit rate (Hit) and avoid rate (Avo) of the 
user and nearby synced or engaged allies.

The engage weapon Lyrátion increases all 
adjacent allies' engage meters by 1 when the 
wielder initiates combat and defeats a foe.

The engage skill Attuned greatly increases 
engage partners' stats when they initiate 
combat and defeat a foe.

The engage attack Dragon Blast launches both 
a sword and magic attack, dealing heavy 
damage even to foes with high Def and Res.

Unlike other Emblems, Emblem 's 
bond level is tied to the ally's support 
level instead of bond EXP.

No support level translates to bond level 1. 
Support level C translates to bond level 5, B 
to bond level 10, and A to bond level 20.
Emblem 's Bond
Emblem

Emblem Marth strikes quickly and repeatedly, 
dominating foes with his nimble grace.

The sync skill Perceptive makes it easier 
to avoid enemy counterattacks.

The engage weapon Rapier deals bonus damage 
against cavalry and armored enemies.

The engage skill Divine Speed adds an 
additional, less powerful attack.

The engage attack Lodestar Rush is a powerful 
and blindingly fast flurry of blows.
Emblem Marth
Emblem Micaiah specializes in healing magic.

With the sync skill Cleric, a unit can use staves 
regardless of class.

The engage weapon Shine attacks and 
illuminates the area when used.

The engage skill Augment increases 
staff range and area of effect.

The engage attack Great Sacrifice fully 
restores the HP of all allies at a cost of 
reducing the user's HP to 1.
Emblem Micaiah

Emblem Roy's excellent offense and defense 
make him well-suited to the front lines.

The sync skill Hold Out allows a unit to survive 
most combat with 1 HP.

The engage weapon Lancereaver, unlike most 
swords, is strong against lances and weak 
against axes.

The engage skill Rise Above temporarily 
raises a unit's level and stats.

The engage attack Blazing Lion strikes several 
spaces in front of the user and ignites the 
terrain in flames.
Emblem Roy

Emblem Sigurd's exceptional mobility allows 
him to move around the battlefield with ease.

The sync skill Canter allows the unit to 
move one more time after attacking.

The engage weapon Ridersbane can deal bonus 
damage to cavalry.

The engage skill Gallop increases 
movement (Mov) by 5.

The engage attack Override charges 
through foes in a line, damaging any 
enemies in the way.
Emblem Sigurd

Trade materials and gold for clothing and 
accessories to wear around the Somniel.

Once made, most accessories can be worn 
by anyone.

As the story progresses, more 
items will become available.
Boutique

On the Achievements screen, you can claim 
bond fragment rewards for various deeds.

You will be notified when you complete an 
achievement. Remember to collect your 
well-earned bond fragments!
Achievements
You can scan amiibo to earn items and rewards.

You will receive special rewards when you 
scan a Fire Emblem amiibo.
The amiibo Gazebo is open.
amiibo Gazebo

You can adopt the animals you encounter while 
exploring and bring them back to the Somniel.

After you adopt them, you can let your animals 
graze in the farmyard. They may even drop 
goods and ingredients that you can use.

If you donate to countries using the bulletin 
board, you will be able to adopt more animals.
You are now able to adopt animals.
Animals

In the Arena, you can have allies train to earn 
experience and raise bond levels.

In Standard Training, an ally you choose will 
spar with another ally. It costs nothing, but you 
can only do it a few times between battles.

Emblem Training increases the bond between 
an ally and an Emblem. It costs bond fragments, 
but you can do it as much as you like.
The doors to the Arena have opened.
Arena

The Somniel is your base. Use this area 
to prepare for the next battle and interact 
with your allies.

Additional activities and areas of the Somniel 
will unlock as you progress through the story.

Open the world map to continue your 
adventure. Access it from the menu or 
by using the exit in the plaza.
The Somniel

Earn rewards by taking on special challenges 
at the Tower of Trials.

In Tempest Trials, the aim is to clear several 
maps in a row. You can set the difficulty before 
you start.

In Relay Trials, you will team up with players 
online to take turns battling foes.

In Outrealm Trials, you can battle other players' 
armies online using maps of your own creation.

All items you use are restored at the end of a 
trial. Your allies are also restored to their 
pre-trial states.

You'll get some experience and other rewards 
for battles you've cleared at the end of the trial.

Since the changes to your army aren't 
permanent, feel free to hold nothing back!
Trial Battles
The Tower of Trials has been unlocked.
Tower of Trials

Café Terrace is a relaxing communal space 
with access points to other facilities.

Use the music box to change the 
background music on the Somniel.

The bulletin board is full of useful information. 
You can use it to invest in Elyos or check 
on your achievements.
Café Terrace is now open.
Café Terrace
Order meals to eat with your allies.

If the meal is prepared well, your allies will 
receive a stat boost in the next battle.
Dine with your allies to earn support points.

The chef may pack some leftovers for you. 
You can take this meal into battle and use 
it as an item to recover HP.
Café Terrace is open for dining.
Dining

You can create Bond Rings 
using bond fragments.

Bond Rings increase stats and allow units to 
earn SP, though not to the same extent as 
Emblem Rings 	 do.
Creating Bond Rings

In Wyvern Ride, you fly through a course 
while shooting floating targets.

Try to hit the special targets and aim for a high 
score! More courses will unlock as you progress 
in the story.
You are now able to play Wyvern Ride!
Wyvern Ride

Trade materials and gold to strengthen 
your weapons at the smithy.

Improve or upgrade your weapons by 
refining and engraving them.

Alter a weapon by engraving it with the power 
of an Emblem. Each Emblem can be applied to 
one weapon at a time.

You can also exchange one type of refining 
material for another.
The smithy and boutique are open.
Smithy

You can use certain materials to augment your 
engage weapons. Crystals increase stats, while 
banes add effectiveness against unit types.

You can earn the materials to augment engage 
weapons in Tempest Trials or Relay Trials.

Each engage weapon has an augmentation 
capacity. You cannot augment a weapon 
past its capacity.

You can strip away augmentations to try out 
new effects, or increase an engage weapon's 
capacity by raising the Emblem's bond level.

You can now augment your Emblems' engage 
weapons in the Ring Chamber.
Engage Weapons

You can now fish in the pond. Press A 
to cast your line. Keep an eye out for the 
ripples big fish make.

Press A when the fishing float drops 
to its lowest point to hook the fish.

If the fish struggles, tilt StickL opposite to its 
movement. Reel the fish in, or it will escape!

Once you've reeled the fish in close, press A 
repeatedly to reduce its endurance.

When its endurance falls to 0, you'll catch it. 
New fishing rods can help you catch bigger fish.
You are now able to go fishing!
Fishing

The flea market offers items you might not find 
in regular shops.
The selection changes, so check in regularly.
The flea market is open.
Flea Market

The fortune-teller, Seadall, uses cards 
to ply his trade.

He is only available in the evening, 
so visit once the sun goes down.
The fortune-teller is open.
Fortune-Teller

The Ring Chamber is a space to interact 
with Emblems and their rings . You 
can inherit skills from Emblems here.

Using bond fragments, you can create Bond 
Rings or combine and strengthen existing ones.

You can also deepen bonds with Emblems 
by polishing the tarnish of combat off 
their rings .
You can now enter the Ring Chamber.
Ring Chamber

Consult the Somniel map to view the status of 
its facilities and to see where your allies are.
You can select a location to fast travel there.
Somniel Map

Allies can acquire certain skills from 
Emblems using Inherit Skills.

Inheriting skills requires a certain bond level, as 
well as skill points (SP). Earn SP by battling 
with synced Emblems and equipping bond rings.
Equip inherited skills using the Inventory menu.

You can't benefit from the same skill twice, so 
try to avoid overlapping.
Inheriting Skills

If you support countries enough to raise their 
donation levels, they will reward you with gifts.

With a high donation level, a country will have 
more rare monsters that you can earn bonus 
gold or experience for defeating.

A high donation level also means you will find 
more materials while exploring in that country, 
among other things.
Donations

Here you can buy or sell items used in battle 
like vulneraries or staves.

As the story progresses, the shop will stock 
additional items.
Item Shop

The enigmatic has watched 
over this land for untold ages.

If you take good care of , 
something wonderful might happen.

The air in the grotto is suffused with a 
mysterious aura.

Push-ups are about timing. Stop the bar at the 
perfect position right when it speeds up. It ends 
if you miss three times.

Do the specified number of push-ups to 
complete the activity. The bar will get faster 
over time, so stay focused!
Aim to get fit!
Push-Ups

Sit-ups are about button-mashing endurance. 
Mash quickly to raise the bar to the top. It ends 
if it hits the bottom.

Raising the bar will gradually get more difficult, 
but doing it quickly will improve your rating.
Aim to get fit!
Sit-Ups

Squats are about rhythm. Follow the directions 
with StickL and StickR. It ends after three mistakes.

Learning to tilt and rotate StickL and StickR in the right 
way will be key to success.
Aim to get fit!
Squats

In Strength Training, you can choose from 
three different exercises to get temporary 
boosts to 's stats.

Each exercise plays differently and affects a 
different stat. Try for top scores in all of them!

You will unlock more difficulties for each 
exercise as you progress through the story.
Strength Training is now available!
Strength Training

This is your room─the sacred place where 
slept for a thousand years.

Select Rest to take a nap and 
advance time on the Somniel.

You may hear some interesting things while 
resting. Wear headphones for the best sound.

Select Reminisce to view past support 
conversations and scenes again.

You can lower the game's difficulty by selecting 
Difficulty Setting. You cannot raise the difficulty 
this way, however.
My Room
You can now access the Records Hall.
Buy or sell weapons here.

The armory's inventory will increase as the 
story progresses and new goods arrive.
The armory and item shop are open.
Armory

Your allies may give you bond fragments 
if you have conversations while exploring.

Use bond fragments on the Somniel to create 
Bond Rings or train with Emblems.

When you finish exploring, you will receive any 
available bond fragments that you missed.
Bond Fragments

After battle, you can explore the map freely 
and converse with your allies.
Keep an eye out for items on the ground.

To finish exploring, either move to the exit or 
press 
Plus to open the menu and select Depart.
Exploration

In Outrealm Trials, you can challenge other 
players' armies on maps you select or design.

Select Quick Battle to pick a map you like and 
begin the battle immediately.

Select Custom Battle to create and upload your 
own map. You can then connect this map to 
other players' maps and begin battle.
Both modes offer rewards at the end of battle.

Connect your map to one uploaded by another 
player. Send out a raiding party and begin 
the battle.

Random: Battle on another player's map that is 
selected at random.

Friend: Choose a map from among those 
uploaded by your friends.

Enter ID: Battle a specific player's map by 
entering their ID.
Start Battle

Choose a map, send out a raiding party, and 
battle another player's army. Select your 
opponent with Random, Friend, or Enter ID.

Random: Start a battle with another player's 
army selected at random.

Friend: Attack a map that has been uploaded 
by one of your friends.

Enter ID: Battle a specific map for which you 
have an ID.
Quick Battle

As you create your own battle maps, consider 
how the terrain you place will shape the flow 
of battle.

Press X to open the terrain list. You can place 
terrain with A and cycle through it with L R.

Consider the defensive strength of your map as 
well. Foes will begin to advance on your map 
once you've uploaded it. Good defense is key.

Finally, to set your defense team, open the 
menu with 
Plus. You can also save your 
map there.

Your maps are ready for battle as soon as 
you are finished making them.

Select Start Battle to connect your map to one 
uploaded by another player. You will deploy 
your raiding party, and the battle will begin.

If your map comes under attack, you can select 
View Results to see the outcome and replay.

Test how well you constructed your map 
with the Mock Battle feature.
Taking Your Maps to Battle

You can customize where the members of your 
defense team are placed, as well as their 
settings and equipment.

Change an ally's movement type by placing 
your cursor on them and pressing A.

Units committed to your defense team cannot 
be deployed in your raiding party, so consider 
your assignments carefully.

When you have finished placing terrain and 
your defense team, select Save Map.
Select Finish Editing when you are done.
Setting Defense Teams
Editing Maps

Test the maps you have made to see how well 
they hold up in battle.

Send a raiding party to your own map to 
test the mettle of your defenses.

If you find something that needs improvement, 
make adjustments with Edit Map.
Mock Battle

If a player launches an attack on a map you 
uploaded, your defense team will take action.

If one of these defensive battles occurs, 
you can see how it went.

Observe how the battle unfolded by watching 
a replay of combat.

You can receive rewards even in defeat, 
but victory yields a greater prize.
View Results

Create and upload your own map, or connect 
your map to another player's and attack.
Select Edit Map to create your battlefield.
Custom Battle
Outrealm Trials

In 2 turns an avalanche will strike 
the lower mountain path.

the middle mountain path.

the upper mountain path.

Fell Sombron will use Howling Beam on his 
next turn. Try to get out of range to avoid

When you place the cursor on an enemy, you 
will see the radius that foe can reach. You can 
press A to keep that radius displayed.

You can press ZL to see the danger radius 
of all your enemies at once.
Danger Radius

The goal of a Relay Trial is to clear a map 
while taking turns with another player, like 
a relay race.

Select New Battle to spend a ticket and start 
a new Relay Trial.

Select Take Over to pick up where 
another player left off.

You will get rewards if any player completes the 
battle. Select View Results to see a replay of 
any trial you took part in.

After playing a predetermined number of turns, 
you must pass control of a Relay Trial on. 
Who can take over your trial is up to you.

There are two ways trials can be taken over. 
Public: Anyone can take over the trial. 
Private: Players must input an ID to take over.

Once someone takes over your trial, select 
View Results to see what happened next.
Passing It On

Up to five allies can be deployed on an 
entryway and on the four surrounding tiles.

Activate dormant entryways by commanding 
an ally to wait on them.

Once an entryway is activated, any player 
taking over the battle can use it to deploy. 
Activate as many as you can!
Entryways

Check the results of your Relay Trials and claim 
rewards if a trial is completed.

You can see the battles of the other players in 
the trial as well as your own. If a battle is still 
ongoing, you can watch up to the present time.

You will still receive rewards if you lose, but 
victory brings better prizes.
Viewing Results

Start a fresh trial to be the first to deploy 
units to the field.
Select a map from the available options.

Preparations will begin once you choose a map. 
Select Fight! to spend your relay ticket and 
begin the trial.
Starting a New Relay Trial

You can also resume another player's trial. 
There are two ways to find a trial to take over.
Random: Take over a trial selected at random.

Enter ID: Enter a Takeover ID to take over 
the trial of a specific player.

Once you have chosen a trial, select Fight! 
to begin.
Taking Over
Relay Trials

Units have various types, such as cavalry, 
qi adept, and mystical. Each type has 
different advantages.
Check a unit's type on the stats screen.
Unit Types

Backup units can add a chain attack 
to an ally's assault.

They will join an ally's attack if they are 
in range.
Backup Units

Covert units gain twice the usual bonuses to 
avoid rate (Avo) from terrain effects.

They thrive in areas with lots of thickets 
or other terrain with beneficial effects.
Covert Units

Dragon units often gain additional effects from 
engage skills and engage attacks.

Increase their bond levels to take full advantage 
of the Emblems' abilities.
Dragon Units

Flying units ignore terrain effects and can pass 
through squares inaccessible to units on 
the ground.

While these units can navigate the battlefield 
with ease, they are vulnerable to bows.
Flying Units

Armored units do not break when attacked with 
a weapon that has advantage.

Their high HP and defense make them reliable 
frontline units, but low resistance can leave 
them vulnerable to magic.
Armored Units
Cavalry units have the highest movement.

Their high mobility allows them to cross the 
map quickly to land a first blow or aid an ally.
Cavalry Units

Mystical units ignore terrain bonuses to a foe's 
avoid rate (Avo) when attacking with magic.

Mystical units can land attacks from a distance 
even when an enemy should be hard to hit.
Mystical Units

Qi adept units can use Chain Guard 
to protect adjacent allies from attack.

With Chain Guard, the ally does not take 
damage. Instead, the qi adept takes damage 
equal to 20% of their own max HP.

Chain Guard is only available 
if the qi adept unit's HP is full.
Qi Adept Units
